example.eg: I have a complete set of Dickens, bound in blue leather.
example.egtrans: 我有全套狄更斯的小说，是用蓝色皮革装订的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 套, 套装, 成套工具

example.eg: Don't worry, I will get my set of tools and fix it.
example.egtrans: 别担心，我会拿上我那套工具修好它的。

example.eg: We are experiencing technical difficulties. Do not adjust your set.
example.egtrans: 我们遇到了技术困难，请勿调试你的电视机。

example.eg: What time does the sun set today?
example.egtrans: 今天日落是什么时候？

example.eg: This jelly will set in four hours.
example.egtrans: 这种肉冻要四个小时才能凝固。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 凝结, 凝固, 定型

example.eg: The plaster needs twenty-four hours to set properly.  Leave enough time to let the glue set.
example.egtrans: 石膏需要24小时才能彻底凝固。预留足够的时间来让胶水凝固。

example.eg: He set the glass on the edge of the table.
example.egtrans: 他把玻璃杯放在桌子边儿上了。

example.eg: You could tell Olivia was determined from the set expression on her face.
example.egtrans: 你可以从奥利维亚脸上僵硬的表情看出她决心已定。

example.eg: Eleanor's set hours of work are 9 am to 5 pm, Monday to Friday.
example.egtrans: 埃莉诺的固定工作时间是周一至周五，每天早上的9点到下午的5点。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 事先约定好的, 固定的

example.eg: There is no set way to do it; you can choose your favorite method.
example.egtrans: 没有什么标准的完成方式，你可以按自己的喜好选择方法。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 公式化的，标准的, 老一套的

example.eg: Students should ensure they buy copies of set texts before the beginning of term.
example.egtrans: 学生应该确保在学期开始前购买了指定的教材。

example.eg: Madeleine's nails were painted, her hair was set, so she was ready to go to the dance.
example.egtrans: 玛德琳的指甲涂好了，发型也定型完毕，看来她已经准备好出发去跳舞了。

example.eg: Marcus is set on getting into Oxford.
example.egtrans: 马库斯坚决要去牛津念书。

example.eg: I have made a new set of friends.
example.egtrans: 我新交了一群朋友。

example.eg: What do you think of the set of this suit?
example.egtrans: 这件套装你觉得怎么样？

example.eg: Do you like this matching set that I bought?
example.egtrans: 你喜欢我买的这一套搭配吗？

example.eg: He has an arrogant set to him and I don't like that.
example.egtrans: 他举止傲慢，这点我很不喜欢。

example.eg: The tennis player won the third set to win the whole match.
example.egtrans: 那名网球运动员拿下了第三局，赢得了整场比赛。

example.eg: The actor needed to be on set all day, as they were filming.
example.egtrans: 在电影拍摄过程中，演员需要整天都待在拍摄现场。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 拍摄现场, 舞台，演出现场

example.eg: I have bought fifty onion sets this year.
example.egtrans: 今年，我已经买了50枚洋葱球茎了。

example.eg: After finishing her set, the violinist bowed for the audience.
example.egtrans: 乐组演奏完毕之后，小提琴手起身向观众鞠躬。

example.eg: A is a subset of set B.
Rose is in the top set for French.
example.egtrans: 罗斯是法语组最高级别中的一员。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一群人, 一个阶层, 一个级别

example.eg: The boss set his employees to work on the project.
example.egtrans: 老板让下属开始进行该项目。

example.eg: Your hair will set well if you use this hairspray.
example.egtrans: 用这款定型喷雾可完美固定发型。

example.eg: That dress sets very nicely on you.
example.egtrans: 那条裙子你穿十分合身。

example.eg: I had lots of flowers on my chilli plants this year, but the fruits didn't set.
example.egtrans: 今年，我的辣椒开了很多花，不过没有结出果实。

example.eg: The hen is setting in the nest.
The teacher set his pupils several tasks.
Can you set this report for me in a plain typeface?
The poem was set to music.
I just changed the battery in the clock, so I have to set the time on it again.
The doctors in casualty set the broken bone.
This writer set the form for this genre of poetry.
Kids, come set the table for dinner.  We need plates and bowls.
She set the chess pieces in their place.
He set a trap for the mouse in the apartment.
The stylist set the woman's hair beautifully.
Let's set the price of the shirt at twenty dollars.
example.egtrans: 这款衬衫我们定价在二十美元吧。

example.eg: Let's set a June date for the wedding.
The leader set the pace in the bike race.
The jeweller set the stone in the ring.
While the curtains were closed, they quickly set the next scene.
This tree sets fruit in the late summer.
Jeremy set a course for the West.
example.egtrans: 杰里米设好航线，驶向西方。

example.eg: The crew set the sails and the ship left the harbour.
example.egtrans: 船员们扬帆起航。

example.eg: The boss sets the hours we work. The sales targets have been set for this month.
example.egtrans: 老板规定我们的工作时间。这个月的销售额目标已经确定了。

example.eg: Hens may try to peck you when you set them.
How do you set the screen background on this phone?

dsense.name: set [sth] in [sth], set [sth] against [sth]
dsense.guideword: often passive (locate, place: story) (故事、电影等)

example.eg: Helena set her story against the backdrop of the Second World War. The novel is set in 19th-century Paris.
example.egtrans: 海伦娜以第二次世界大战作为自己故事的背景。这本小说以19世纪的巴黎为背景。

example.eg: Julius set about arranging his collection of butterflies.
example.egtrans: 朱利叶斯开始整理自己的蝴蝶收藏。

example.eg: The burglars set about their victim when they were disturbed.
example.egtrans: 窃贼被干扰的时候，袭击了受害人。

example.eg: Please don't set him against me by spreading rumors that I talk about him behind his back.
This amount of money looks very small if you set it against what we spend each year on marketing.
Stein's intelligence sets him apart from other soccer players.
The family set one bedroom apart for use by guests.
I set aside my work to check on the baby.  Set your pencils aside and read through the test first.
example.egtrans: 我暂时放下手中的工作去看看宝宝。请暂时将你的铅笔放在一边，先通读试卷。

example.eg: Set your fears aside and jump into the water.
example.egtrans: 放下你的恐惧，大胆地跳进水里去。

example.eg: Estelle set by some sandwiches in case she felt hungry later in the day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 留出, 搁起来以备将来之需

example.eg: She set down the book on a nearby table.
example.egtrans: 她将书放在附近的一张桌子上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 放在, 放置, 放下

example.eg: If you set your thoughts down on paper first, it helps you to think about things more clearly.
example.egtrans: 如果你能先把自己的想法写下来，这样就能更有条理地进进行思考。

example.eg: In his autobiography, he sets forth the story of his life.
example.egtrans: 在自传中，他讲述自己的人生故事。

example.eg: The gallant knight set forth to slay the dragon.
example.egtrans: 那名英勇的骑士动身去屠龙。

example.eg: Frustration among the fans set in just before half-time, when it became clear their team was unlikely to score.
We'll have to set off very early to avoid the rush-hour traffic.
That morning, we set off on our trip to California.
I usually set off for work at 8 a.m.
He set off an alarm when he opened the back door.
The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand set off the First World War.
That colour looks good on you; it sets off your eyes.
Don't mention politics to Richard; you'll set him off.
When we refused to hand over our wallets, they set on us with a pair of baseball bats.
example.egtrans: 我们拒绝交出钱包，他们就用一对棒球棒攻击我们。

example.eg: The hunters set the dogs on the scent.
example.egtrans: 猎人放出猎犬来追踪气味。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让…对…发起袭击, 使…袭击, 释放……，放出……，放开……

example.eg: If you go into that garden, the owner will set his dog on you.
example.egtrans: 如果你进到花园里，花园的主人就会让狗攻击你。

example.eg: They set out for London early the following day.  We'll set out at five in the morning.
example.egtrans: 他们隔天早晨就动身前往伦敦。

example.eg: Isabelle set out the cutlery for dinner.
Each member of the committee set out their ideas, then they all took a vote.
The constitution sets out the council's decision-making procedures.
Columbus set out for Asia in 1492, but ended up in the Bahamas.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 动身前往, 去往, 出发去

example.eg: Jason and the Argonauts set out on their quest for the Golden Fleece.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 开始，着手, 启程去，上路去

example.eg: I didn't set out to hurt you; I'm sorry if what I said was upsetting.
example.egtrans: 我不想伤害你。如果我说的让你难过，我对此表示歉意。

example.eg: He set out to mend the fences, but ran out of wire before he was halfway done.
Are we all set? Then let's go!
Are you all set for opening night?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为…准备好, 准备就绪

example.eg: We were all set to leave, but Ann made us wait while she looked for her cell phone.
I just bought the box set of the StarTrek Voyager series on DVD for $200!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 全季电视剧, 电视剧集

example.eg: Justin has close-set eyebrows.
Mark was dead set on becoming a naval pilot.
example.egtrans: 马克下决心要成为海军飞行员。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坚决的, 坚定的, 下定决心的

example.eg: Jerry was dead set against the Prime Minister's proposal.
Edward looked at Gillian with his deep-set eyes.
My dinette set is starting to look rather shabby.
example.egtrans: 我的餐厅家具开始显得有点破落了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 餐桌餐椅, 餐厅家具

example.eg: It's always noisy at my house now; my brother got a drum set for his birthday.
Hank was really excited as it was his first time on a film set.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 电影场景, 电影布景

example.eg: This is the biggest, fastest roller-coaster in the world - so hold tight and get set for the ride of your life!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为...准备好, 为...预备好

example.eg: A heavy-set security guard was standing in front of the embassy.
example.egtrans: 一位身材魁梧的保安站在大使馆前。

dsense.name: jet set, jetset
dsense.guideword: informal (wealthy leisure travelers) (常乘飞机旅行的)

example.eg: Marbella and Dubai are both popular resorts for the jet set.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有钱人一族, 富豪一族
富豪一族的, 有钱人的

example.eg: The millionaire spends his time jet-setting around the world.
You need a positive mindset to overcome these obstacles.
example.egtrans: 要克服这些困难，你需要有一个积极的心态。

example.eg: Even though they played best friends, the actors didn't really get along on set.

dsense.name: put [sb]'s mind at rest, set [sb]'s mind at rest, set [sb]'s heart at rest

example.eg: Let me just put your mind at rest: your condition is completely treatable.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使消除疑虑, 使安心

dsense.name: "Ready, set, go!" (US), "Ready, steady, go!" (UK), "On your marks, get set, go!"

example.eg: Runners: Ready, set, go!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 各就各位, 预备, 跑!

example.eg: Johnson set a record in the long jump this afternoon.
We set a trap for him to see if we were right about him stealing from the till.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为某人设下陷阱, 给某人下套

example.eg: We set the rowing boat afloat.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让…漂浮在水面，将…推下水

example.eg: The rioters set a police car alight.
example.egtrans: 暴徒们放火烧了一辆警车。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 点燃, 点着, 放火烧

example.eg: It really set me back when I lost my job.
This repair work is likely to set me back more than £500.
The boss set the meeting back to give people more time to complete their reports.
We can set the appointment back a few days if you can't make it tomorrow.
When you look at the garden you'll see that the birch tree's set back against the fence.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处于不突出处的, 在...后面的

example.eg: At about 3 months, a baby begins to focus its eyes on objects set before him.
They are likely to set conditions for the authorization of this loan.
Rather than negotiate each sale individually, they have set conditions that they never vary from.
The set designer's done some excellent work on this opera.
He set fire to his own house to collect the insurance money.
Liam has never set foot in England.  Peter is so rude. I'll never set foot in his house again!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 访问，到访, 去，到往, 踏入

example.eg: With their saddlebags full and joy in their hearts, they set forward on their quest.
Can you remember what year Nelson Mandela was set free?
They have set in motion the official procedures for emigrating to Canada.
My grandmother set all her affairs in order shortly before she died.

dsense.name: set in stone, set in concrete

example.eg: These are just guidelines; nothing is set in stone yet.
Chris is set in his ways; he doesn't like trying anything new.
It's important for parents to set limits so their children learn how to behave.
Instead of buying just one wine glass, I decided to get a set of three.
He bought a set of two candles in matching colors.
To cover up the murder, the killer set his victim's house on fire.
That catchy new song has set the whole country on fire.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使激动, 使情绪高涨

example.eg: Harry's explanation was nothing but set phrases.

dsense.name: set piece
dsense.guideword: (film, book: scene or extract) (戏剧、音乐、绘画等遵循著名的固定模式或风格的)

example.eg: At the end of the film, there is a set piece involving a gun battle.
The soccer players were trying out set pieces during their training session.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 按照计划执行的事情, 精心部署下的行动

dsense.name: set point
dsense.guideword: (tennis: point that will win a set) (网球比赛的)

example.eg: Her last backhand went into the net, so she only had one set point remaining.
Every lesson you plan to teach should have a set purpose.
The windjammer set sail for a tour around the Caribbean.

dsense.name: set sail
dsense.guideword: (start a journey by ship or boat) (指乘船)

example.eg: The flower will set seed in late summer.
example.egtrans: 这种花会在夏末结籽。
